summary: Taxpayers don’t have to go to court to appeal IRS decisions such as tax bills. They have the option of bringing their cases to IRS’s Office of Appeals. Its mission is to resolve disputes in a timely manner that is fair to the government and taxpayer. Among other things, we found: information on the length of the appeals process was not readily available, making it...
title: Tax Administration: Opportunities Exist to Improve Monitoring and Transparency of Appeal Resolution Timeliness
